title: From Hating Math to Actually Liking It: Our 6-Month Soroban Journey
description: My daughter used to cry over math homework. After 6 months of soroban, she volunteers to help with grocery calculations. Here's what changed.
imageAlt: Child transformed from hating math to loving it

content.intro: Six months ago, homework time was a nightmare. "I hate math!" with tears, every single day. I was desperate. A friend suggested soroban, and I thought, "More math? She'll never go for it." I was wrong.

sections.text: Emma, 7, had developed serious math anxiety by 2nd grade. Symptoms:

items: Crying before math homework
"I can't do it" before even trying
Guessing randomly to finish faster
Physical stress (stomach aches on test days)
Saying "I'm not a math person"

sections.text: I was heartbroken. She was 7. How does a 7-year-old already believe she can't do math?
I was hesitant – more math sounded like torture. But a friend explained:

items: It's visual and tactile, not just numbers on paper
It's gamified in apps – feels like playing
It starts extremely simple, building confidence
Success is immediate and visible

sections.text: We tried the free trial, expecting her to hate it. She didn't.
Emma actually LIKED the soroban app. Why?

items: It felt like a game, not homework
She got points and rewards
Problems were easy enough to succeed
Moving beads was satisfying
"I'm getting so many right!"

sections.text: The first time she said "I'm good at this!" about anything math-related, I almost cried.

items: Simple addition became automatic
She started doing mental math unprompted
Homework battles decreased (not eliminated, but better)
"This one's easy" started appearing
She asked to help add up the grocery bill
She explained soroban to her cousin (teaching!)
She said "Math is okay" (from "I hate math" – huge!)
Test anxiety is less (not gone, but manageable)
Homework has some struggles but no more tears
**Success breeds confidence:** Early wins mattered enormously
**Different approach:** Visual/tactile vs. abstract numbers
**No pressure:** 15 minutes of "playing" vs. homework battles
**Consistent practice:** Daily, even when she didn't feel like it
**Patience:** 6 months, not 6 weeks

sections.text: She's not a math genius now. She still struggles with some concepts. But she no longer believes she CAN'T do math. That mindset shift is everything.

faq.question: Did math grades improve?
faq.answer: Somewhat – B's instead of C's. More importantly, the stress and tears stopped. Grades may keep improving; confidence is already transformed.

faq.question: How did you handle days she didn't want to practice?
faq.answer: Shortened to 5 minutes. "Just do 5 problems, then you're done." Consistency over volume.

faq.question: Would this work for every kid with math anxiety?
faq.answer: Not guaranteed. But for kids whose anxiety comes from not understanding numbers, soroban's visual approach can help rebuild from the foundation.

cta.text: Start your child's journey from math anxiety to math confidence.
